image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit as he stands in front of Parliament House

props.synopsis: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers has unveiled his financial blueprint as the nation inches closer to a closely fought election. Follow live.

title.children: Budget 2025: Coalition slams tax cuts as 'cruel hoax' in pre-election budget

image.altText: Jim Chalmers, Anthony Albanese and Katy Gallagher

props.synopsis: Labor will take Australians to an election within days, setting up a battle with Opposition Leader Peter Dutton over an extra $17 billion in income tax cuts.

title.children: Surprise $17b in tax cuts sets up election clash

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has delivered its final budget ahead of an election in May, with a fresh new round of tax cuts the major offer. Find out who else is set to benefit and who may miss out.

title.children: Find out if you're among the budget's winners or losers

image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers arrives on budget day

props.synopsis: Have you ever seen a treasurer, obliged on budget night to confirm that the national books have slid $42b into the red on his watch, looking quite so incredibly chipper?

title.children: Consider this the treasurer's refusal to sign a non-compete clause

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding several pages of a household power bill in their hands

props.synopsis: Changes to Medicare, fresh tax cuts and more energy bill relief — here's what the federal government's latest budget means for the cost-of-living crisis.

title.children: From students to pensioners, here's what the budget means for your bills

image.altText: an illustration of jim chalmers with roads and cash

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers warned there would be little, if anything, new in this document given the government had planned to call an election earlier this month, negating the need for a budget. That plan took an abrupt about turn.

title.children: The $17b tax cut no-one saw coming came at the right time for Labor

image.altText: A view of housing at Whyalla at dawn.

props.synopsis: The federal government will spend another $800 million to provide first home buyers with the opportunity to own a property with lower deposits and smaller mortgages.

title.children: The budget expands the Help to Buy housing scheme. Here's how it works

image.altText: A close-up of hands holding scissors and a comb, cutting hair.

props.synopsis: The Albanese government will ban non-compete clauses for nearly 3 million workers and crack down on anti-competitive labour practices.

title.children: Three million workers could benefit from ban on non-compete clauses

image.altText: Brandon Borrello looks on

props.synopsis: The Socceroos are in Hangzhou to take on China, looking for back-to-back World Cup qualifier victories. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Socceroos silence record crowd in China after horror goalkeeper error

image.altText: Lady holding a wallet with 20 dollar bills.

props.synopsis: Businesses reliant on Australian workers to buy their goods and services will cheer news the federal budget will leave more cash in the pockets of their customers. But firms may face more competition to hang on to their staff, with reforms to abolish non-compete clauses for most workers.

title.children: Will the budget's 'cup of coffee' tax cut be a boost for business?

image.altText: An illustration of a large stadium in a green park near the CBD.

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli, who promised multiple times not to build a new stadium before the state election, declares Victoria Park is a "clear" choice for the Olympics and Paralympics.

title.children: 'A clear choice': New 63,000-seat stadium to be built in Brisbane for 2032 Games

image.altText: Piles of cigarettes in a Melbourne warehouse

props.synopsis: The tobacco excise has seen cigarettes taxes become a lucrative source of revenue for the federal government, pouring billions into its coffers each year.

title.children: Booming trade in illegal cigarettes costing the budget billions

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor pushes through legislation that could derail a legal battle over salmon farming's impact on an endangered ray and safeguard the industry's future in Tasmania.

title.children: Changes to laws pass lower house in attempt to protect salmon jobs

image.altText: The 23andMe logo seen on a smartphone

props.synopsis: The genomic testing company says the way it stores data hasn't changed and any new buyers would have to follow the "applicable law" about security.

title.children: What does 23andMe's collapse mean for customers' data?

image.altText: Peter Hegseth is surrounded by reporters holding phones and microphones.

props.synopsis: In any other presidency, the story would rock the US: top national security advisers mistakenly adding a journalist to their group chat. But Washington is not what it used to be.

title.children: The red flags raised by Team Trump's latest blunder

image.altText: Kings Cross Stills of buildings and signs with people walking around the streets.

props.synopsis: Privacy rights have been raised after a content creator from the United States covertly filmed women in Sydney using smart glasses. These are your rights when it comes to being filmed or recorded in public.

title.children: If someone films you in public, these are your rights

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A mob of sheep in a yard.

props.synopsis: Scientists call for the federal government to invest more in preventing the disease from spreading to Australia's $5 billion sheep meat industry.

title.children: Australia on alert after UK detects world's first case of bird flu in sheep

image.altText: A photo of a capsized boat with people on its head

props.synopsis: The death of an Australian tourist on a snorkelling boat that capsized near Bali once again raises concerns over boat safety for tourists.

title.children: If you want to ride Bali's fast boats, here's how to do it safely

image.altText: Ruby Wax promo picture

props.synopsis: Comedian Ruby Wax says Donald Trump “hated” her so much, he threw her off his plane in a notorious interview.

title.children: 'He hated me': Comedian Ruby Wax on her infamous interview with the US president

image.altText: Building with people walking in front

props.synopsis: The University of Wollongong will cut up to 10 per cent of its non-academic staff in its latest round of redundancies, which it claims is a consequence of changes to international student visa processing.

title.children: University cuts up to 180 more jobs amid student visa changes

image.altText: A blindfolded man is loaded into the back of a van at night time

props.synopsis: A documentary maker is among three Palestinians beaten and detained in the West Bank, according to a co-director who says he witnessed the arrest.

title.children: Oscar-winning director beaten by Israeli settlers, witnesses say

image.altText: A woman standing in front of a microphone at a press conference, outside, with bushland in the background.

props.synopsis: A minimum mandatory prison sentence will be reintroduced for offenders who repeatedly breach a domestic violence order and harm their victim, the Northern Territory government has announced.

title.children: Mandatory sentences for repeat DVO breaches to be reinstated in the NT

image.altText: Pete Hegseth, standing above Donald Trump, spread his hands.

props.synopsis: The incident has been condemned as one of the most "stunning and dangerous" breaches of military intelligence ever seen.

title.children: Trump officials accidentally texted a journalist war plans

image.altText: Comedian Sashi Perera and her husband Charlie embrance on the dance floor of their post-elopement party.

props.synopsis: When my husband and I eloped in 2020, we promised ourselves that we'd have a big party later. After the pandemic, miscarriages and my father's death, it was time to manufacture some joy.

title.children: Our newlywed years were grief-filled, so we threw a 'not wedding' party

image.altText: People stand around a car with all its doors open with a sign in beg letters on the wall behind reading BYD.

props.synopsis: Chinese electric vehicle manufacturer BYD has unveiled its ultra-fast charger that promises to take just five minutes to fully power EVs — putting heat on rival Tesla in the process. But analysts say the electricity grid may not be ready, in Australia at least.

title.children: Chinese EV company BYD takes fight to Tesla, as Elon's global sales slump

image.altText: An aerial photo of a large industrial work site in Port Pirie.

props.synopsis: Plans for a $750 million green hydrogen facility at Port Pirie, which was initially announced in 2021, have been shelved, the state government says.

title.children: Green hydrogen project at Port Pirie smelter shelved

image.altText: Man in a formal blue suit speaking at a podium with "SAMSUNG" logo.

props.synopsis: Han Jong-hee, the co-CEO of South Korean tech giant Samsung Electronics has died at age 63.

title.children: Samsung Electronics co-CEO dies, leaving new appointee in charge

image.altText: Exterior of a new school building.

props.synopsis: A northern NSW secondary school has gone into lockdown as police arrested a woman and two girls after an alleged assault on a student.

title.children: Students arrested, four staff hurt in NSW school incident

image.altText: Owen Cooper leans back in a chair and smirks while acting in Adolescence.

props.synopsis: Parenting experts and psychologists say we should be talking with our teenagers about the themes raised in the crime drama.

title.children: Netflix's Adolescence raises tough questions for parents. Let's unpack them

image.altText: A man in front of a colourful wall

props.synopsis: A former Alice Springs school principal charged with allegedly assaulting several children has stepped down from town council citing "personal and professional obstacles".

title.children: Former Alice Springs principal resigns from council amid child assault charges

image.altText: Man using Facebook with a ban symbol

props.synopsis: Facebook users in Papua New Guinea remain offline after the government carried out what it described as "testing" to regulate hate speech and offensive content.

title.children: Facebook shut down in PNG in 'test' to stop 'pornography, misinformation'

image.altText: Headshot of Basil Zempilas speaking.

props.synopsis: Is Basil Zempilas the silver bullet the WA Liberals so desperately need? Even within the party's own ranks, opinions are divided.

title.children: Will Basil Zempilas be a lifeline or a liability for the WA Liberals?

image.altText: Yellow-brown floodwater extends across horizon, with fences and trees poking out from the water.

props.synopsis: Towns are cut off and properties inundated, as one grazier records more than 350 millimetres of rain in 48 hours — more than he usually sees in 12 months.

title.children: Major stock losses on the cards as flood sweeps south-west Queensland
